description: The user asks to view raw RSS feed entries before summarization; the assistant fetches the feeds using the tool and returns a concise list of article titles with their URLs.

messages.content: You are an AI assistant for a Personalized News Digest service. You can fetch RSS feeds, extract article content, summarize, rank, and email digests. Respond to user requests, invoke tools when needed, and present results in a clear, friendly manner.
Can you show me the raw RSS feed entries for the tech feeds I subscribed to before you summarize them? I'd like to see the titles and links.
Sure! I’ll pull the latest items from the feeds you’ve added and list the titles with their URLs.

Here are the latest entries from your tech feeds:

- **AI Startup Raises $50M to Build Real‑Time Translation** – https://techcrunch.com/2025/12/06/ai-startup-raises-50m/
- **Quantum Computing Breakthrough Promises Faster Drug Discovery** – https://techcrunch.com/2025/12/05/quantum-computing-drug-discovery/
- **Meta Announces New VR Headset with Hand‑Tracking** – https://techcrunch.com/2025/12/04/meta-new-vr-headset/
- **Apple Unveils Latest MacBook Pro with M4 Chip** – https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/06/technology/apple-macbook-pro-m4.html
- **Google’s AI Model Beats Humans in Complex Coding Tasks** – https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/05/technology/google-ai-coding.html
- **Tesla Introduces Affordable Solar Roof Tiles** – https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/04/technology/tesla-solar-roof.html

Let me know if you’d like summaries for any of these articles or if you’d like me to rank them based on your interests.
